page.title: 03POPULATION
page.content: The parish has always been entirely {agricultural.}The{population}before the general bulge of the 19th. century averaging perhaps 300 - increasing by 1880 to over 800, then{declining}over the next century to 300-350 where it now stands. In the past most people worked on the land but very few do now. The 1971 Census indicated that 60% of the population were employed and this includes a higher proportion of working women than is usual in rural areas. This is partly due to {company transport}provided to Sudbury, Glemsford, Great Yeldham, Hedingham, Haverhill and Wratting and out working at home. In 1971 17% of the population were {retired persons}and this is increasing. The number of young children is decreasing.
